com.basho.riak.client.core.query.indexes

Class RiakIndex<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basho.riak.client.core.query.indexes.RiakIndex<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigIntIndex, LongIntIndex, RawIndex, StringBinIndex

    public abstract class RiakIndex<T>
extends Object
implements Iterable<T>
    Abstract base class for modeling a Riak Secondary Index (2i).

    Secondary Indexing (2i) in Riak gives developers the ability, at write time, to tag an object stored in Riak with one or more queryable values. Since the KV data is completely opaque to 2i, the user must tell 2i exactly what attribute to index on and what its index value should be, via key/value metadata. This is different from Search, which parses the data and builds indexes based on a schema. Riak 2i currently requires the LevelDB or Memory backend.

    A RiakIndex is made up of the index name, a type, then one or more queryable index values.

    RiakIndex instances are created and managed via the RiakIndexes container.

    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Brian Roach
    See Also:
    RiakIndexes, Using Secondary Indexes in Riak
    Thread Safety:
    This class is designed to be thread safe.

      • iterator

        public final Iterator<T> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the asSet of values in this index. This iterator is a "weakly consistent" iterator that will never throw ConcurrentModificationException, and guarantees to traverse elements as they existed upon construction of the iterator, and may (but is not guaranteed to) reflect any modifications subsequent to construction.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<T>
        Returns:
        an Iterator.

      • convert

        protected abstract BinaryValue convert(T value)
        Convert a value to a BinaryValue.

        Index values are stored internally as bytes. Concrete classes implement this method to convert values to bytes.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert
        Returns:
        a BinaryValue containing the converted bytes

      • convert

        Index values are stored internally as bytes. Concrete classes implement this method to convert bytes to values.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(Object obj)
        Indicates whether this RiakIndex is "equal to" another RiakIndex.

        Only the name and index type of the RiakIndex are used to determine equality.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
